page.title: 11Housing
page.content: The villaes contain a mix of old farm cottages, council houses/bungalows built 1930/1960's immediately post 1945 houses and a scattering of large pre 1939 houses, paticularly in Great Bealings. Lt Bealings had substantial bungalow development on the edge of the village in 1960s. A number of more expensive houses built since 1970 in rushmere, Great Bealings and Playford reflect the type of family now moving into the area but commuting out for work. The new properties are mainly 'infill' as the area is a Green Belt for Ipswich. 20 older cottages lack one or more basic amenities but uprading of cottaes is frequent, for use by commuters or as second homes by people living and working elsewhere, usually London. Farm houses are often large and prestigious ones owned by non-farmers.
